intro: Martinella iquitoensis, commonly known as the Iquitoensis Martinella, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the wet season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found near water sources. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
